name: Oppenheimer
summary: A dramatization of the life of J. Robert Oppenheimer and the creation of the atomic bomb — blending biography, history, and intense moral complexity in a sweeping, cinematic scale.

name: Killers of the Flower Moon
summary: A historical crime drama about the murders of Osage Nation members in 1920s Oklahoma after oil is discovered — a dark, meticulous portrait of greed, exploitation, and justice.

name: The Zone of Interest
summary: A haunting, silent-style drama that depicts the ordinary domestic life of an Auschwitz commandant and his family juxtaposed with the horrors outside — a chilling meditation on complicity and evil.

name: Poor Things
summary: A wild, surrealist reimagining of Frankenstein: a revived young woman explores life, identity, and desire — provocative, visually bold, and emotionally unpredictable.

name: The Holdovers
summary: Set in a boarding school over Christmas break, a curmudgeonly teacher and a troubled student form an unlikely bond — a moving, character-driven story about loss, connection, and redemption.

name: Beau Is Afraid
summary: A long, hallucinatory odyssey through fear and trauma after the sudden death of a mother — strange, unsettling, and deeply psychological.

name: The Killer
summary: A cold, meticulous assassin thriller — terse, stylish, and ethically ambiguous, offering a dark meditation on violence and identity.

name: Barbie
summary: A sharp, satirical take on identity, feminism, and society's expectations — playful yet subversive, blending comedy with social commentary.

name: Past Lives
summary: A delicate, intimate drama about love, memory, and fate — subtle in tone and deeply affecting in its portrayal of relationships across time.

name: Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse
director: Joaquim Dos Santos, Kemp Powers, Justin K. Thompson
summary: A vibrant, innovative animated superhero film blending thrilling action, emotional stakes, and stylistic brilliance — widely praised for its ambition and heart.

name: Dune: Part Two
summary: The epic continuation of the Dune saga — political intrigue, war, prophecy and destiny collide on a grand sci-fi scale, delivering spectacle and emotional weight.

name: The Brutalist
summary: A post-war epic about a European architect emigrating to America — a sweeping, intimate journey of displacement, ambition, and the search for identity.

name: Anora
summary: A gritty-yet-tender dramedy about a Brooklyn sex worker drawn into a dangerous, complicated world — mixing humor, loneliness, survival and the longing for something more.

name: Challengers
summary: A tense romantic-drama / sports film exploring ambition, love triangles, and psychological pressure — cinematic and emotionally charged.

name: Wicked: Part One
summary: A lavish fantasy musical bringing a beloved story to life with grandeur — dazzling visuals, strong performances, and escapist spectacle.

name: Ghostlight
summary: A film blending mood, mystery and emotional nuance — quietly impactful and notable among the year's more contemplative works.

name: Nosferatu
summary: A gothic horror re-imagining: atmospheric, unsettling and moody — drawing on classic horror roots while offering fresh stylistic vision.

name: The Wild Robot
summary: An animated / family-friendly film combining adventure, heart, and thoughtful themes — among the year’s standout for its warmth and accessibility.

name: Small Things Like These
summary: A quieter, character-driven drama tackling redemption, memory, and personal reckoning — subtle but resonant storytelling.

name: The Substance
summary: A provocative, emotionally raw film that resonated with audiences and critics for its boldness and thematic depth.

name: Sinners
summary: A genre-blending horror film with social commentary — using vampire mythos and historical context to explore race, trauma, and power.

name: The Mastermind
summary: One of the year’s most talked-about films — a smart, daring movie that challenges expectations and pushes cinematic boundaries.

name: The Secret Agent
summary: A stylish political thriller — tense, morally complex, and widely praised as one of 2025’s standout achievements.

name: The Phoenician Scheme
summary: A grand, ambitious film blending drama, power, and philosophical undertones — visually striking and narratively bold.

name: Hedda
summary: A modern-inflected adaptation / re-imagining that captivated critics, notable for its atmosphere, character work, and intensity.

name: Afternoons of Paris
summary: A quieter, humanistic film — intimate, emotionally thoughtful, and praised for its depth and subtlety.

name: Hamnet
summary: A meditative drama dealing with grief and loss — beautifully crafted and emotionally resonant.

name: Roofman
summary: A moving, character-centered film balancing heart and stakes — one of the standouts among 2025’s new releases.

name: Kill the Jockey
summary: A surreal, daring film — perhaps divisive, but emblematic of 2025’s willingness to take creative risks and push boundaries.

name: One Battle After Another
summary: A sweeping, ambitious epic — combining political stakes, personal drama, and cinematic ambition, marking a high point in 2025’s film output.
